hero.agencyName: NATIONAL AQUATIC RESOURCES RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT AGENCY
hero.slogan: Safeguarding Sri Lanka's Aquatic Wealth and Health Through Science
hero.description: Advancing scientific research and innovation in marine and aquatic resources through responsible management, sustainable practices, and cutting-edge research to protect ecosystems and drive the nation's blue economy.

overview.tagline: Sri Lanka's Premier Marine & Freshwater Research Agency
overview.description: Advancing scientific research and innovation in marine and aquatic resources through responsible management, sustainable practices, and cutting-edge research to protect ecosystems and drive the nation's blue economy.

research.heading: Research Excellence
research.description: Leading ocean research with cutting-edge technology and scientific innovation

intelligence.description: Monitor ocean conditions, marine traffic, and environmental data in real-time with our advanced satellite and sensor network covering Sri Lankan waters.

mission.heading: Safeguarding Sri Lanka's Aquatic Wealth Through Science
mission.description: The National Aquatic Resources Research & Development Agency (NARA) is Sri Lanka's premier institute for marine and freshwater science, dedicated to safeguarding and sustainably developing the nation's aquatic wealth. We conduct cutting-edge research, guide policy on fisheries and ocean resources, and drive innovation in the Blue Economy to benefit ecosystems and communities.
mission.focusResearch: Coastal, deep sea, and inland water programmes powering national policy and the blue economy.
mission.focusCommunity: Alliances with fishing communities, academia, and defence agencies safeguard livelihoods and maritime security.
mission.briefing: Live observatories, ocean drones, and GovCERT-secured data streams coordinate a 200 NM protective radius across Sri Lanka’s sovereign waters.

partners.label: For Partners
partners.heading: A guided hand-off for external teams
partners.body: Partners receive clear documentation, a sandbox key, and a support contact to keep them moving.
benefits: Step-by-step quick start guide with sample requests
Sandbox and production keys managed from one place
Status alerts so partners know when data refreshes

admin.label: For NARA Teams
admin.heading: Keep manual control when you need it
admin.body: The admin panel lets staff post new data, approve changes, and pause access without touching code.
benefits: Upload files or edit copy with built-in checks
Optional approvals so sensitive updates get reviewed
Pause or resume feeds with a single toggle

playground.label: Try It First
playground.heading: Experiment safely before you go live
playground.body: A ready-made playground mirrors the live endpoints so teams can prototype and learn quickly.
benefits: Mock responses that mirror live payloads

security.title: Trust built in
security.body: Role-based access, audit history, and automated alerts protect national data while keeping partners informed.
checklist: Separate sandbox and production keys for every partner
Automatic email when thresholds or quotas are reached
Exportable audit trail for compliance reviews

news.heading: Latest News & Updates
news.subheading: Stay informed with our recent announcements and activities

articles.title: Bridging Research and Policy for Blue Growth: NARA Scientific Sessions 2025
articles.description: NARA's flagship annual symposium successfully concluded, bringing together marine scientists and policymakers to strategize on sustainable fisheries management and the blue economy roadmap for 2030.
articles.fullContent: The National Aquatic Resources Research and Development Agency (NARA) successfully held its Scientific Sessions 2025 under the theme 'Bridging Research and Policy for Blue Growth.' The event, held in Colombo, emphasized the critical role of scientific research in sustainable fisheries management, protecting aquatic ecosystems, and advancing Sri Lanka's blue economy. Over 200 researchers, policymakers, and industry stakeholders participated, presenting findings on climate resilience, deep-sea exploration, and aquaculture innovations.

articles.title: Construction Begins for Sri Lanka Ocean and Fisheries Data Center (SOFDC)
articles.description: A landmark collaboration with KIOST and Haebom Data Inc. to build a state-of-the-art data center dedicated to aquatic research and digitalization.
articles.fullContent: NARA, in collaboration with the Korea Institute of Ocean Science & Technology (KIOST) and Haebom Data Inc., has initiated the construction of the new Sri Lanka Ocean and Fisheries Data Center (SOFDC). This state-of-the-art facility will serve as the central hub for the country's aquatic research data, enhancing digital capabilities in ocean monitoring, fisheries forecasting, and climate data analysis. The project marks a significant step forward in NARA's digital transformation journey.

articles.title: $3 Million Grant Secured for Marine Infrastructure Upgrade
articles.description: NARA has secured major international funding to modernize its research vessel fleet and upgrade coastal laboratories, enhancing our deep-sea monitoring capabilities.
articles.fullContent: In a major boost to Sri Lanka's marine research capabilities, NARA has secured $3 million in international funding. This grant is earmarked for the modernization of the research vessel fleet and the upgrading of coastal laboratories. The investment will significantly enhance NARA's capacity for deep-sea monitoring, water quality analysis, and real-time oceanographic surveillance, ensuring Sri Lanka remains at the forefront of Indian Ocean marine science.

articles.title: NARA at Aqua Planet Sri Lanka 2025
articles.description: Showcasing scientific innovations at the International Aquatic Expo to commemorate World Fisheries Day.
articles.fullContent: Coinciding with World Fisheries Day, NARA played a strategic scientific role at the 'Aqua Planet Sri Lanka 2025' International Aquatic Expo. The agency showcased its latest innovations in sustainable aquaculture, value-added marine products, and ocean observation technologies. The exhibition provided a platform to connect with industry leaders, investors, and the public, highlighting the economic potential of Sri Lanka's aquatic resources.
